title: 'By playing with fire, Macron could end up burning himself and dragging the country into the blaze'
summary: By announcing the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale following the Rassemblement National's landslide victory, the French president is seeking to divert attention and avoid infighting within his own camp. A foolishly risky operation, according to Solenn de Royer.

title: French snap elections: Le Pen extends hand to conservatives and her Zemmour-allied niece
summary: Marine Le Pen and her lieutenant Jordan Bardella opened the door to alliances with members of the far-right Reconquête! party and the conservative Les Républicains party in the upcoming elections.

title: French snap elections: Glucksmann proposes former trade union leader as prime minister
summary: Laurent Berger, the former head of one of France's biggest unions, could be deemed a 'responsible' figure to appoint as prime minister if the left were to win the elections, suggested Raphaël Glucksmann, the Socialists' lead candidate in the European elections.

title: Why Macron decided to call snap elections
summary: A small group of close confidants quietly worked on this high-risk scenario. Allies of former president Nicolas Sarkozy pushed President Macron to take the plunge. Sunday's catastrophic score in the European elections precipitated the decision.

title: Ramifications of France's snap elections: 'Political time has been suspended'
summary: After the far right claimed a large victory in the European elections and President Emmanuel Macron decided to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale, Nicolas Chapuis, one of Le Monde's deputy editors, answered readers' questions on the political consequences.

title: Snap elections in France: How it works, precedents, and consequences
summary: Following the far-right Rassemblement National's sweeping victory in the European elections, Emmanuel Macron has decided to dissolve to the Assemblée Nationale for the first time since 1997.

title: EU election results: Giorgia Meloni consolidates her position both in Italy and in Europe
summary: The Italian prime minister, who led her far-right party's list, won 28.9% of the vote, exceeding her score from the 2022 legislative elections. She intends to pursue dialogue with the French far-right party, Rassemblement National.

title: European election results: A more conservative Parliament under pressure from far right
summary: The mainstream conservative parties are set to come under pressure from the far-right in Parliament after the European elections saw their record gains, particularly in France and Germany, and the collapse of the Greens.

title: UN Security Council votes for US-drafted Gaza ceasefire resolution
summary: The text welcomes a cease-fire proposal announced by President Joe Biden that the United States says Israel has accepted. Hamas responded to the adoption by saying it welcomed the resolution and was ready to work with mediators in indirect negotiations with Israel to implement it.

title: Five articles to understand the situation in France after Macron called snap elections
summary: President Macron's coalition was heavily defeated by the far right in the European elections on Sunday. He decided to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale and call early elections as a result.

title: Map: The 2024 European election results in France, town by town
summary: View the final results in every town and city on our interactive map.

title: Avian flu: New human infections reported as epizootic rapidly spreads in the US
summary: The H5N1 virus continues to spread in American dairy farms. Moderately concerned, scientists criticize the lack of transparency necessary for better managing the risk that this virus originating in animals might mutate and become transmissible between humans.

title: Faced with Russian threat, Sweden trains more and more young conscripts
summary: As war rumbles on Europe's doorstep, Sweden plans to double the number of conscripts by 2032. The Scandinavian country, which abandoned its traditional neutrality in March to become a full member of NATO, sees this as a response to rising dangers.

title: Modi begins third term under pressure from his allies
summary: The Indian prime minister, who was sworn in on Sunday, will lead a new government of 71 ministers.

title: A plane carrying Malawi Vice President Saulos Chilima goes missing
summary: Aviation authorities have been unable to make contact with the plane carrying Malawi's Vice President Saulos Chilima since it 'went off radar' on Monday.

title: Paris mayor says snap elections weeks before Olympics 'extremely troubling'
summary: Mayor Anne Hidalgo said she was 'stunned' to hear President Emmanuel Macron call for early elections that will take place less than a month before the start of the Paris Games.

title: Rising danger on the border between Lebanon and Israel
summary: Hezbollah has intensified the frequency and scale of its attacks on northern Israel, while Israel has threatened a military operation.

title: Bardella to be far-right candidate for French prime minister
summary: The Rassemblement National's 28-year-old leader was nominated after President Emmanuel Macron announced snap parliamentary elections following the far right's historic lead in Sunday's EU elections.

title: After Glucksmann's strong score in European elections, Socialists are divided over next steps
summary: The Socialist-backed candidate was not far behind the presidential camp, with 13.8%. But the question of a left-wing alliance after Emmanuel Macron's shock snap election announcement is already threatening to tear the PS apart.
